org.opends.server.admin.std.client

Interface AdministrationConnectorCfgClient

  • All Superinterfaces:
    ConfigurationClient

    public interface AdministrationConnectorCfgClient
extends ConfigurationClient
    A client-side interface for reading and modifying Administration Connector settings.

    The Administration Connector is used to interact with administration tools using LDAP.

      • getListenAddress

        java.util.SortedSet<java.net.InetAddress> getListenAddress()
        Gets the "listen-address" property.

        Specifies the address or set of addresses on which this Administration Connector should listen for connections from LDAP clients.

        Multiple addresses may be provided as separate values for this attribute. If no values are provided, then the Administration Connector listens on all interfaces.

        Returns:
        Returns the values of the "listen-address" property.

      • setListenAddress

        void setListenAddress(java.util.Collection<java.net.InetAddress> values)
                      throws IllegalPropertyValueException
        Sets the "listen-address" property.

        Specifies the address or set of addresses on which this Administration Connector should listen for connections from LDAP clients.

        Multiple addresses may be provided as separate values for this attribute. If no values are provided, then the Administration Connector listens on all interfaces.

        Parameters:
        values - The values of the "listen-address" property.
        Throws:
        IllegalPropertyValueException - If one or more of the new values are invalid.

      • getListenPort

        java.lang.Integer getListenPort()
        Gets the "listen-port" property.

        Specifies the port number on which the Administration Connector will listen for connections from clients.

        Only a single port number may be provided.

        Returns:
        Returns the value of the "listen-port" property.

        java.lang.String getSSLCertNickname()
        Gets the "ssl-cert-nickname" property.
